articles.description: Keanon Lowe prevented a potential tragedy last year when he disarmed -- and then hugged -- a young student who brought a gun to school.

articles.author: Clare Foran and Manu Raju, CNN
articles.title: Senate approves defense bill with veto-proof majority in rebuke to Trump
articles.description: The Senate voted overwhelmingly on Friday to approve a sweeping defense bill with a veto-proof majority, a major rebuke to President Donald Trump who has urged Republican opposition and threatened to veto the legislation. The vote was 84 to 13.

articles.title: See the TikTok team that's tackling Covid-19 vaccine misinformation
articles.description: CNN's Anna Stewart reports on Team Halo, a group of health experts who create TikToks meant to encourage confidence in coronavirus vaccines by answering frequently asked questions and debunking vaccine misinformation.

articles.author: Paul R. La Monica, CNN Business
articles.title: Biotechs working on breast cancer treatments see shares soar -- then tank
articles.description: Covid-19 vaccines are on everyone's mind, including investors in pharmaceutical and biotech stocks.

articles.author: Scottie Andrew, CNN
articles.title: A snow leopard has tested positive for coronavirus, making it the sixth confirmed animal species
articles.description: Another big cat tested positive for coronavirus, this time a snow leopard at a Kentucky zoo. It's the sixth animal species confirmed to have been infected with the virus after human contact

articles.title: Manhattan DA interviewed employees at Trump's bank and insurer in criminal probe

articles.title: CDC director: We will have more deaths from Covid-19 per day than 9/11
articles.description: Public health experts including Dr. Anthony Fauci and CDC director Robert Redfield are warning Americans about the spread of the coronavirus as cases spike following the Thanksgiving holiday. CNN's John King breaks down the latest pandemic numbers.

articles.author: Opinion by Steve Case and John K. Delaney for CNN Business Perspectives
articles.title: Entrepreneurs create jobs. They deserve stimulus, too
articles.description: If small businesses are shutting down — something that happens even in the absence of a global pandemic — then we need to make sure we are creating new companies.

articles.author: Peter Valdes-Dapena and Valentina Di Donato for CNN Business
articles.title: Ferrari CEO Louis Camilleri retires 'with immediate effect'
articles.description: Ferrari chief executive Louis Camilleri has retired "with immediate effect," the company announced late Thursday.

articles.author: Opinion by John Bare
articles.title: Love, death and pie: My last moments with my wife
articles.description: John Bare writes about his wife, Betsy, who died from Covid-19 in September. They both tested positive in August, but Betsy, who suffered from several chronic illnesses, caught the virus at the same time she had a blood infection. To process the pain, John ha…

articles.author: Kathryn Vasel, CNN Business
articles.title: Want to switch careers? Don't let the pandemic stop you
articles.description: Many unemployed workers are using their existing skills to break into a new career.

articles.author: Anneken Tappe, CNN Business
articles.title: Americans are feeling better about the economy as hopes for Biden administration outweigh pandemic worries
articles.description: Consumer sentiment rebounded sharply -- and surprisingly -- in December on the heels of Joe Biden's election win, which outweighed worries about the coronavirus pandemic, the University of Michigan's Survey of Consumers showed Friday.

articles.author: Josh Campbell, CNN
articles.title: Schools remain key targets for hackers, US intelligence officials say
articles.description: Malicious cyber actors are continuing to wreak havoc on America's educational institutions during the deadly coronavirus pandemic, according to US intelligence officials.
articles.content:

articles.author: Manu Raju, CNN Senior Congressional Correspondent
articles.title: Dianne Feinstein defends her service, won't say if she will commit to a full six years
articles.description: Sen. Dianne Feinstein, the 87-year-old California Democrat who has faced growing questions about her ability to do her job, defended her service but did not commit to serving out her full term that expires in 2025.

articles.title: Festival organizers apologize after packed parties without social distancing or masks in Mexico

articles.description: Time magazine picked President-elect Joe Biden and his running mate, Vice President-elect Kamala Harris as 2020's Person of the Year, also recognizing health workers and racial justice advocates.
